abstracts.cdata!:
The Vilnius District Heating Project
            aims at reducing the cost of, and at improving the quality
            of district heating supply, while supporting the commercial
            viability, and possible privatization of the Vilnius
            District Heating Company (VDHC). The Project will focus
            district heating investments in areas where VDHC has a
            competitive advantage as well as related energy efficiency
            investments in households. A fundamental design change in
            heat supply would be facilitated by investments in
            substations designed to improve the quality of district
            heating supply by enabling temperature control by the
            consumer. The Project will also support demand-side
            investments to enable decreases in heat losses and further
            improvements in temperature control. Following are some of
            the negative impacts and mitigating measures. Due to
            constructions there will be some noise, dust, disposal of
            solid materials, and water leakage. Mitigating measures will
            include: activities in apartments to take place during
            daytime in order to avoid noise at night time, and minimize
            the presence of children, and shall conform to noise
            ordinance and regulations. During cutting/welding process,
            measures of natural ventilation will be taken. Metal parts,
            if any, will be removed from the apartments and sent for recycling.
